channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Engineering Test Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Engineering Test Management

item.title: CVE-2020-4495|2024-08-04T08:07:49.055Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper access control. By sending a specially-crafted request to the REST API, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass access restrictions, and execute arbitrary actions with administrative privileges. IBM X-Force ID: 182114.

item.title: CVE-2021-38934|2024-08-04T01:51:20.467Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Test Management 7.0, 7.0.1, and 7.0.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 210671.

item.title: CVE-2020-4974|2024-08-04T08:14:59.404Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation products are vulnerable to server side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 192434.

item.title: CVE-2023-43054|2024-06-04T17:26:04.846Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Test Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 267459.

item.title: CVE-2023-43054|2024-08-02T19:37:23.119Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Test Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 267459.
